hero.title: Hi, I'm Hanna Kaczy≈Ñska üëã
hero.subtitle: I code front-end and explore full-stack. Check out my projects and get to know me better.

about.hero:
I‚Äôm a system-oriented developer focused on front-end and steadily expanding toward full-stack work. 
I enjoy solving problems, understanding how things fit together, and building clean, user-friendly interfaces.

intro.title: How It All Started
intro.text: A few years ago, I felt like I was standing still ‚Äî I was missing growth, an engaged team, and projects that truly excited me. Then I accidentally stumbled upon a programming webinar. I joined ‚Äújust out of curiosity,‚Äù but quickly realized it was something for me ‚Äî logical, creative, and full of challenges. Within a few days, I decided to start learning.

first_steps.title: My First Steps in Programming
first_steps.text: From the beginning, I was fascinated by how code fits together like a puzzle. Every problem felt like a mini-challenge, every step meant growth, and the first results appeared almost instantly. Over time, I started to understand application architecture more deeply ‚Äî and it gave me huge satisfaction.

experience.title: Experiences That Shaped Me
experience.text: My previous experience turned out to be extremely valuable: working with quality systems taught me analytical and process-oriented thinking and documenting solutions; running a micro-business taught me organization and combining many requirements into one coherent system.

education.title: Building My Technical Foundations
education.textone: I built my technical foundations thanks to the
education.texttwo: These programs helped me take my first steps, learn good practices, and build my first projects. The
education.textthree: training helped me streamline my workflow.

project_individual.title: My First Individual Project
project_individual.text: I learned the most while building my first individual full-stack project ‚Äî DestillApp. I chose the technologies myself, designed the architecture, and created the features without ready-made mockups or guidelines. It was challenging, sometimes frustrating, but incredibly rewarding.

project_team.title: Teamwork
project_team.text: In the team project Filmoteka, I first experienced what real teamwork in IT feels like: shared goals, task distribution, supporting each other, and solving problems together. This experience confirmed that I want to keep growing in this field.

now.title: What Drives Me Today
now.text: Today I‚Äôm driven by curiosity, persistence, and the desire to build things that make sense ‚Äî improve, organize, help. I value good practices, clear communication, and projects where the whole is greater than the sum of its parts.

cta.title: Got a challenge for me? Let‚Äôs talk.
cta.text: I‚Äôd be happy to join a team where I can grow and bring real value.

destillapp.title: DestillApp
destillapp.description:
A full-stack application designed to manage and document the distillation of aromatic plants. 
The system centralizes plant data, distillation batches, results, and user settings ‚Äî offering an efficient workflow for small-scale distillation studios or botanical research environments. 
Built with a modern TypeScript‚Äìpowered Vue 3 frontend and a GraphQL API backend, DestillationApp delivers a clean, structured, and reliable tool for handling the entire distillation lifecycle. 
Designed and implemented end-to-end as a solo project ‚Äî from concept and architecture to API design, UI development, documentation, and deployment preparation.
destillapp.alt: View of the login page of the DestillApp application

features.name: Authentication & Security
list: Secure JWT and bcrypt-based authentication
Route protection within the application
Sanitization of data sent to the database
Ability for users to change their password

features.name: Plant & Distillation Management
list: Managing plant inventory: add, edit, delete
Recording, editing, and deleting distillation processes
Assigning and managing distillation results
Filtering and sorting plants, distillations, and results by name or date

features.name: Frontend Application
list: Vue 3 + TypeScript for modular and typed components
Vuex for centralized state management
Apollo Client for communicating with the GraphQL backend
Selected Vuetify components and responsive design

features.name: GraphQL API Ecosystem
list: Modular architecture of GraphQL resolvers and schemas
Flexible management of distillation, plant, and result data
MongoDB and Mongoose for structured data modeling

features.name: Documentation & Code Quality
list: Automatic frontend documentation with VitePress
TypeDoc generating documentation for TypeScript files
JSDoc for backend modules and utilities
Frontend testing environment with Vitest

features.name: Error Monitoring
list: Sentry integration for frontend error reporting

responsibilities.overview: Since this was a solo project, I handled the entire development process:
list: Designed the full system architecture (frontend, backend, GraphQL API, data layer)
Created a complete user interface in Vue 3 and TypeScript, ensuring modularity and type safety.
Implemented all application logic using Vuex, Apollo Client, and Vuetify components
Developed the backend using Node.js, Express, and Apollo Server with a complete GraphQL schema
Created database models and data operations using MongoDB and Mongoose
Implemented secure JWT-based authentication with permission checks and data sanitization
Prepared technical documentation (VitePress, TypeDoc, JSDoc) and foundational unit testing setup (Vitest)
Integrated Sentry for error and performance monitoring
Collaborated with a DevOps engineer on deployment planning and workflow design

backend.name: MongoDB + Mongoose
backend.description: schema-based data modeling and database access

wallet-app.title: Wallet App
wallet-app.description:
A full-stack personal finance manager designed to help users track income, expenses, and spending habits in a clear, intuitive interface. 
The application offers secure authentication, interactive charts, real-time currency conversion, and a clean UX optimized for quick daily use. 
Developed as part of the GoIT course, based on a provided Figma design, and built independently as a complete end-to-end product ‚Äî from architecture to deployment.
wallet-app.alt: View of the login page of the Wallet App application

features.name: Authentication & Security
list: JWT access & refresh token flow
Token blacklisting for logout safety
Encrypted passwords (bcrypt)

features.name: Transaction Management
list: Add, edit, delete transactions
Income/expense categorization
Balance calculations with filtering by date

features.name: Analytics Dashboard
list: Interactive Recharts visualizations
Spending summaries

features.name: Currency Rates
list: Up-to-date EUR/GBP rates
Automatic hourly rate updates

features.name: User-Friendly UI & UX
list: Responsive design: mobile ‚Üí desktop
Form validation (Formik + Yup)
Demo mode for instant app exploration

features.name: Developer Tools
list: Full Swagger API documentation

responsibilities.overview: Since this was a solo project, I handled the entire development process:
list: Designed the system architecture (frontend, backend, authentication flow)
Converted Figma designs into a responsive and accessible UI
Implemented all UI logic in React with Redux Toolkit
Built the backend in Node.js using Express, MongoDB, and Mongoose
Implemented secure JWT authentication with token refresh and revocation
Created REST API endpoints and Swagger documentation
Deployed the frontend (Netlify) and backend (Heroku)

frontend.name: Redux Toolkit
frontend.description: global state management for transactions & auth

frontend.name: Figma
frontend.description: use of pre-made graphics and UI assets

imgalt.screen4: Main dashboard with account balance, recent transactions list, and currency exchange rates

portfolio.title: Developer Portfolio
portfolio.description:
A personal developer portfolio built with Nuxt 3, showcasing my projects, skills, and providing easy ways to get in touch. 
The project was fully developed solo, focusing on a modern, responsive, and user-friendly design. 
The site is fully accessible and SEO-optimized, supporting two languages (EN/PL) with quick language switching. 
The portfolio includes interactive project carousels, optimized images, as well as a convenient contact form and links to resources and social media.
portfolio.alt: View of the main page of the Developer Portfolio application

features.name: Project Showcase
list: Interactive project carousels
Image optimization in WebP/AVIF with fallbacks
Project data loaded from local files

features.name: Information & Contact
list: Contact form for sending messages
Access to CV and certificates in PDF format
Links to social media and email

features.name: Internationalization
list: Support for two languages (EN/PL) with i18n
Language switching via button
Content and URL paths change according to the selected language

features.name: Responsive Design & UX
list: Mobile-first design with SCSS
Nuxt UI components for consistent appearance
Focus on accessibility and user-friendly UX

features.name: SEO & Performance
list: Static site generation
Automatic meta tags, sitemap.xml, and robots.txt
Lazy loading of resources

responsibilities.overview: As a solo project, I was responsible for the entire portfolio creation process:
list: Designed the structure and architecture with Nuxt 3
Created a responsive UI using Nuxt UI and SCSS
Implemented interactive project carousels with Embla Carousel
Configured bilingual support using i18n
Implemented a contact form with validation and EmailJS integration
Optimized SEO (meta tags, sitemap, robots.txt) and performance
Ensured full accessibility: ARIA, semantic HTML, keyboard navigation, focus management, color contrast
Deployed the portfolio on Vercel, with static site distribution and HTTPS/CDN support

frontend.name: Nuxt 3
frontend.description: Vue framework for SSG and full frontend development

filmoteka.title: Filmoteka
filmoteka.description:
A team project as part of the GOIT course, creating a dynamic movie search application with trailer previews, detailed film information, and a personalized watchlist feature. 
Built using vanilla JavaScript with Axios for API communication, it follows a mobile-first approach and provides a responsive, interactive interface. 
Users can search for films, watch trailers, explore detailed descriptions, and manage their personal ‚Äúwatched‚Äù or ‚Äúto-watch‚Äù lists. 
This project demonstrates practical teamwork, frontend logic implementation, and integration of third-party libraries for UI and pagination enhancements.
filmoteka.alt: View of the top part of the Filmoteka movie search application

features.name: Movie Discovery & Watchlist
list: Search and filter movies from an external API
Add movies to ‚Äúwatched‚Äù or ‚Äúto-watch‚Äù lists
Trailer playback for selected movies
Detailed film information

features.name: Responsive Interface
list: Dynamic movie cards rendering based on search results
Adaptive layout optimized for mobile and desktop devices
Smooth interaction with modals and pagination

features.name: Interactive Components & UI Enhancements
list: Loading spinners using spin.js for better UX
Notifications and alerts via Notiflix
Pagination handled by tui-pagination
Modal windows for trailers and additional movie info
Implemented movie search functionality with dynamic rendering of results in responsive cards
Added movie trailer playback in modal window
Assisted with watchlist functionality and loading spinner behavior
Collaborated with teammates on debugging and refining interactive features

frontend.name: Vanilla JavaScript
frontend.description: dynamic UI rendering and state handling

frontend.name: Axios
frontend.description: fetching data from an external movie API

frontend.description: use of pre-made graphics and UI assets

icecream-shop.title: Icecream Shop
icecream-shop.description:
A promotional landing page website created for a fictional ice-cream brand, developed as a team project during the GoIT course. 
The site was built based on detailed Figma mockups and follows strict UI and branding guidelines. 
Designed with a mobile-first approach, it features clean visuals, structured content sections, and smooth responsiveness across devices.
icecream-shop.alt: View of the top part of the Icecream Shop landing page

features.name: Responsive Layout
list: Mobile-first design
Smooth adaptation across devices
Clean and structured sections

features.name: Figma-based UI
list: Pixel-perfect sections matching mockups
Consistent branding and layout
Team coordination based on shared design

features.name: Interactive Elements
list: Navigation linking to specific page sections
Mobile menu available on smaller devices
Intro animation displayed on initial page load
Implemented the footer based on Figma mockups
Added contact information and social media links
Ensured proper footer display on both mobile and desktop devices
Collaborated with the team to maintain overall visual consistency
